availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Cox (Webster Co. KY, constable)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, constable. Missouri native. Son of Temperance B. Cox. Married to Mary E Cargile Cox. Student in St. Clair County, Missouri, in 1850. Student in St. Clair County in 1860. Constable in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Clair County, District 79, p. 118B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Clair County, Osceola, p. 888.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Nebo Precinct 4, p.3.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Webster County, KY, June 1863, p.11.
"William McFarlin Cox (1843-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial #74824870, accessed November 8, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74824870.
